title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1263.2 - Public passenger ramp and apron area charges
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1263.2 - Public passenger ramp and apron area charges

State Regulations
(a) For an aircraft remaining on the public
passenger ramp and apron area adjacent to the International Arrival Building
for more than 10 minutes after the manager of the air terminal has directed
that such aircraft be removed because of congestion of aircraft upon the said
area, the urgency for making space available for other aircraft, snow removal, or other operational requirements, which said notice shall not in any event be
given to an aircraft which has been assigned a parking position until the
aircraft has been on such area for 20 minutes: (1)

For the first 15 minutes or fraction
thereof............ $ 50
(2)

For
each additional 15 minutes or fraction thereof............ $100
(b) For an aircraft remaining on
the designated public aircraft hardstands adjacent to the east and west wing
buildings: (1)

For the first three hours or
fraction thereof............ $25
(2)

For each additional three hours or
fraction thereof............ $25

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1263.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
